nfs_Write.c

Go to the documentation of this file.

00146 extern writeverf3  NFS3_write_verifier ; /* NFS V3 write verifier      */
00147  
00148 int nfs_Write( nfs_arg_t              * parg,    
00149                exportlist_t           * pexport, 
00150                fsal_op_context_t      * pcontext,   
00151                cache_inode_client_t   * pclient,
00152                hash_table_t           * ht,
00153                struct svc_req         * preq,    
00154                nfs_res_t              * pres )
00155 {
00156   static char     funcName[] = "nfs_Write";
00157   
00158   cache_entry_t           * pentry ;
00159   fsal_attrib_list_t        attr ;
00160   fsal_attrib_list_t        pre_attr ;
00161   fsal_attrib_list_t      * ppre_attr ;
00162   int                       rc ;
00163   cache_inode_status_t      cache_status = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS;
00164   cache_content_status_t    content_status ;
00165   fsal_seek_t               seek_descriptor ;
00166   fsal_size_t               size = 0 ;
00167   fsal_size_t               written_size;
00168   fsal_off_t                offset = 0;
00169   caddr_t                   data = NULL;
00170   enum stable_how           stable;     /* NFS V3 storage stability, see RFC1813 page 50 */
00171   cache_inode_file_type_t   filetype      ;
00172   fsal_boolean_t            eof_met ;
00173  
00174   cache_content_policy_data_t datapol ;
00175 
00176   datapol.UseMaxCacheSize = FALSE ;
00177  
00178   if( preq->rq_vers == NFS_V3 )
00179    {
00180         /* to avoid setting it on each error case */
00181         pres->res_write3.WRITE3res_u.resfail.file_wcc.before.attributes_follow = FALSE;
00182         pres->res_write3.WRITE3res_u.resfail.file_wcc.after.attributes_follow  = FALSE;
00183         ppre_attr = NULL;
00184    }
00185   
00186         /* Convert file handle into a cache entry */ 
00187   if( ( pentry = nfs_FhandleToCache( preq->rq_vers, 
00188                                      &(parg->arg_write2.file),
00189                                      &(parg->arg_write3.file),
00190                                      NULL, 
00191                                      &(pres->res_attr2.status),
00192                                      &(pres->res_write3.status),
00193                                      NULL,
00194                                      &pre_attr, 
00195                                      pcontext, 
00196                                      pclient, 
00197                                      ht, 
00198                                      &rc ) ) == NULL )
00199     {
00200       /* Stale NFS FH ? */
00201       return rc ;
00202     }
00203   
00204   /* get directory attributes before action (for V3 reply) */
00205   ppre_attr = &pre_attr;
00206   
00207   /* Extract the filetype */
00208   filetype = cache_inode_fsal_type_convert( pre_attr.type ) ;
00209   
00210   /* Sanity check: write only a regular file */
00211   if( filetype != REGULAR_FILE )
00212     {
00213       switch( preq->rq_vers )
00214         {
00215         case NFS_V2:
00216           /*
00217            * In the RFC tell it not good but it does
00218            * not tell what to do ... 
00219            * We use NFSERR_ISDIR for lack of better
00220            */
00221           pres->res_attr2.status = NFSERR_ISDIR;
00222           break;
00223           
00224         case NFS_V3:
00225           if( filetype == DIR_BEGINNING || filetype == DIR_CONTINUE )
00226             pres->res_write3.status = NFS3ERR_ISDIR ;
00227           else
00228             pres->res_write3.status = NFS3ERR_INVAL;
00229           break;
00230         }
00231       return NFS_REQ_OK ;
00232     }
00233   
00234   /* For MDONLY export, reject write operation */
00235   /* Request of type MDONLY_RO were rejected at the nfs_rpc_dispatcher level */
00236   /* This is done by replying EDQUOT (this error is known for not disturbing the client's requests cache */
00237   if( pexport->access_type == ACCESSTYPE_MDONLY )
00238     {
00239       switch( preq->rq_vers )
00240         {
00241         case NFS_V2:
00242           pres->res_attr2.status = NFSERR_DQUOT ;
00243           break;
00244 
00245         case NFS_V3:
00246           pres->res_write3.status = NFS3ERR_DQUOT;
00247           break;
00248         }
00249 
00250        nfs_SetFailedStatus( pcontext, pexport,
00251                             preq->rq_vers, 
00252                             cache_status,
00253                             &pres->res_attr2.status,
00254                             &pres->res_write3.status,
00255                             NULL, NULL,
00256                             pentry, 
00257                             ppre_attr,
00258                             &(pres->res_write3.WRITE3res_u.resfail.file_wcc),
00259                             NULL, NULL, NULL);
00260   
00261        
00262        return NFS_REQ_OK ;
00263     }
00264   
00265   /* Extract the argument from the request */
00266         switch( preq->rq_vers )
00267     {
00268     case NFS_V2:
00269       if( ppre_attr && ppre_attr->filesize > NFS2_MAX_FILESIZE )
00270         {
00271           /*
00272            *  V2 clients don't understand filesizes >
00273            *  2GB, so we don't allow them to alter
00274            *  them in any way. BJP 6/26/2001
00275            */
00276           pres->res_attr2.status = NFSERR_FBIG;
00277           return NFS_REQ_OK ;
00278         }
00279       
00280       offset = parg->arg_write2.offset;           /* beginoffset is obsolete */
00281       size = parg->arg_write2.data.nfsdata2_len;        /* totalcount is obsolete  */
00282       data = parg->arg_write2.data.nfsdata2_val;
00283       stable = FILE_SYNC;
00284       break;
00285       
00286     case NFS_V3:
00287                         offset = parg->arg_write3.offset;
00288                         size = parg->arg_write3.count;
00289 
00290                         if( size > parg->arg_write3.data.data_len)
00291         {
00292           /* should never happen */
00293           pres->res_write3.status = NFS3ERR_INVAL;
00294           return NFS_REQ_OK ;
00295         }
00296 
00297 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFSPROTO
00298       printf( "----> Write offset=%lld count=%u\n", parg->arg_write3.offset, parg->arg_write3.count ) ;
00299 #endif
00300  
00301 
00302     /*
00303      * do not exceed maxium READ/WRITE offset if set
00304      */
00305     if( ( pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_MAXOFFSETWRITE ) == EXPORT_OPTION_MAXOFFSETWRITE )  
00306       if( (fsal_off_t)(size + offset) > pexport->MaxOffsetWrite )
00307         {
00308           
00309           DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_EVENT,
00310               "NFS WRITE: A client tryed to violate max file size %lld for exportid #%hu",
00311               pexport->MaxOffsetWrite, pexport->id ) ;
00312           
00313           switch( preq->rq_vers )
00314                 {
00315                 case NFS_V2:
00316                         pres->res_attr2.status = NFSERR_DQUOT ;
00317                         break;
00318 
00319                 case NFS_V3:
00320                         pres->res_write3.status = NFS3ERR_DQUOT;
00321                         break;
00322                 }
00323     
00324           nfs_SetFailedStatus( pcontext, pexport,
00325                                preq->rq_vers,
00326                                cache_status,
00327                                &pres->res_attr2.status,
00328                                &pres->res_write3.status,
00329                                NULL, NULL,
00330                                pentry,
00331                                ppre_attr,
00332                                &(pres->res_write3.WRITE3res_u.resfail.file_wcc),
00333                                NULL, NULL, NULL);
00334 
00335 
00336           return NFS_REQ_OK ;
00337 
00338         }
00339      
00340         /*
00341          * We should take care not to exceed FSINFO wtmax
00342          * field for the size 
00343          */
00344       if(  ( pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_MAXWRITE == EXPORT_OPTION_MAXWRITE ) &&
00345            size > pexport->MaxWrite )
00346         {
00347           /*
00348            * The client asked for too much data, we
00349            * must restrict him 
00350            */
00351           size = pexport->MaxWrite ;
00352         }
00353                         data = parg->arg_write3.data.data_val;
00354                         stable = parg->arg_write3.stable;
00355                         break;
00356     }
00357  
00358   
00359   if( size == 0 )
00360     {
00361       cache_status = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00362       written_size = 0;
00363     }
00364   else
00365     {
00366       /* An actual write is to be made, prepare it */
00367 
00368       /* If entry is not cached, cache it now */
00369       datapol.UseMaxCacheSize = pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_MAXCACHESIZE ;
00370       datapol.MaxCacheSize = pexport->MaxCacheSize ;
00371 
00372 
00373       if( ( pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_USE_DATACACHE ) && 
00374           ( cache_content_cache_behaviour( pentry, 
00375                                            &datapol,
00376                                            (cache_content_client_t *)pclient->pcontent_client, 
00377                                            &content_status ) == CACHE_CONTENT_FULLY_CACHED ) && 
00378           ( pentry->object.file.pentry_content == NULL ) )
00379         {
00380           /* Entry is not in datacache, but should be in, cache it .
00381            * Several threads may call this function at the first time and a race condition can occur here
00382            * in order to avoid this, cache_inode_add_data_cache is "mutex protected" 
00383            * The first call will create the file content cache entry, the further will return
00384            * with error CACHE_INODE_CACHE_CONTENT_EXISTS which is not a pathological thing here */
00385    
00386           /* Status is set in last argument */
00387           cache_inode_add_data_cache( pentry, 
00388                                       ht, 
00389                                       pclient,
00390                                       pcontext, 
00391                                       &cache_status ) ;
00392           if( ( cache_status != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ) && 
00393               ( cache_status != CACHE_INODE_CACHE_CONTENT_EXISTS ) )
00394             {
00395               /* If we are here, there was an error */
00396               if( nfs_RetryableError( cache_status ) )
00397                 {
00398                   return NFS_REQ_DROP ;
00399                 }
00400               
00401               nfs_SetFailedStatus( pcontext, pexport,
00402                                    preq->rq_vers, 
00403                                    cache_status,
00404                                    &pres->res_attr2.status,
00405                                    &pres->res_write3.status,
00406                                    NULL, NULL,
00407                                    pentry, 
00408                                    ppre_attr,
00409                                    &(pres->res_write3.WRITE3res_u.resfail.file_wcc),
00410                                    NULL, NULL, NULL);
00411               
00412               return NFS_REQ_OK ; 
00413             }
00414         }
00415       
00416       /* only FILE_SYNC mode is supported */
00417       /* Set up uio to define the transfer */
00418       seek_descriptor.whence = FSAL_SEEK_SET ;
00419       seek_descriptor.offset = offset ;
00420 
00421       if( cache_inode_rdwr( pentry, 
00422                             CACHE_CONTENT_WRITE,
00423                             &seek_descriptor,
00424                             size,
00425                             &written_size,
00426                             &attr,
00427                             data, 
00428                             &eof_met,
00429                             ht, 
00430                             pclient, 
00431                             pcontext, 
00432                             &cache_status )  == CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00433         {
00434 
00435           switch (preq->rq_vers)
00436             {
00437             case NFS_V2:
00438               nfs2_FSALattr_To_Fattr( pexport,
00439                                       &attr,
00440                                       &(pres->res_attr2.ATTR2res_u.attributes) );
00441               
00442               pres->res_attr2.status = NFS_OK;
00443               break;
00444               
00445             case NFS_V3:
00446               
00447               /* Build Weak Cache Coherency data */
00448               nfs_SetWccData( pcontext,
00449                               pexport,
00450                               pentry, 
00451                               ppre_attr, 
00452                               &attr,
00453                               &(pres->res_write3.WRITE3res_u.resok.file_wcc) );
00454               
00455               /* Set the written size */
00456               pres->res_write3.WRITE3res_u.resok.count = written_size;
00457               
00458               /* We always use FILE_SYNC mode */
00459               pres->res_write3.WRITE3res_u.resok.committed = FILE_SYNC; 
00460               
00461               /* Set the write verifier */
00462               memcpy(pres->res_write3.WRITE3res_u.resok.verf, 
00463                      NFS3_write_verifier,
00464                      sizeof(writeverf3));
00465               
00466               pres->res_write3.status = NFS3_OK;
00467               break;
00468             }
00469  
00470           return NFS_REQ_OK ;
00471         }
00472     }
00473 
00474 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFSPROTO
00475   printf( "---> failed write: cache_status=%d\n", cache_status ) ;
00476 #endif
00477 
00478   /* If we are here, there was an error */
00479   if( nfs_RetryableError( cache_status ) )
00480     {
00481       return NFS_REQ_DROP ;
00482     }
00483   
00484   nfs_SetFailedStatus( pcontext, pexport,
00485                        preq->rq_vers, 
00486                        cache_status,
00487                        &pres->res_attr2.status,
00488                        &pres->res_write3.status,
00489                        NULL, NULL,
00490                        pentry, 
00491                        ppre_attr,
00492                        &(pres->res_write3.WRITE3res_u.resfail.file_wcc),
00493                        NULL, NULL, NULL);
00494   
00495         return NFS_REQ_OK ;
00496 } /* nfs_Write.c */
00497

00508 void nfs_Write_Free( nfs_res_t * resp )
00509 {
00510   return;
00511 } /* nfs_Write_Free */
